intro: Chamaecrista brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited crown flower, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow,蝶形 flowers. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in sandy or loamy soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
